parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: A reference to a (layer 2 or above) interface object that will be the target of this packet capture diagnostic.

parameter.name: Format
parameter.description: This indicates whether the network trace will be recorded in libpcap {{bibref|LIBPCAP}} or pcapng format, and is dependent on the underlying method of performing a network trace.

enumeration.description: The packet data is recorded in libpcap {{bibref|LIBPCAP}} format.
The packet data is recorded in pcapng format.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: The duration in {{units}} to copy packets to the file target. The diagnostic completes when either the {{param}}, {{param|PacketCount}}, or {{param|ByteCount}} conditions are met.

parameter.name: PacketCount
parameter.description: The maximum number of packets to record to the file target. A value of zero (0) indicates no limit. The diagnostic completes when the {{param|Duration}}, {{param|ByteCount}}, or {{param}} conditions are met.

parameter.name: ByteCount
parameter.description: The maximum number of bytes to record to the file target. A value of zero (0) indicates no limit. The diagnostic completes when {{param|Duration}}, {{param|PacketCount}} or {{param}} conditions are met.

parameter.name: FileTarget
parameter.description: The {{datatype}} specifying the destination file location. The HTTPS transport MUST be supported, and the HTTP transport MAY be supported. Other transports MAY also be supported.

parameter.name: FilterExpression
parameter.description: A ({{bibref|BPF}}) formatted expression used to restrict the types of network packets that are recorded to {{param|FileTarget}}.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the Agent to authenticate with the file location. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is required.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the Agent to authenticate with the file location. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is required.

object.name: PacketCaptureResult.{i}.
object.description: Results for individual packet capture diagnostics. Packet capture files whose FileLocation is local to the system SHOULD be deleted when the next diagnostic is run, or upon a system reboot.

parameter.name: FileLocation
parameter.description: The {{datatype}} specifying the resulting file location of the packet capture record that triggered this result. This MAY be different than the location specified in FileTarget.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: The local system time at which the capture was started.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.description: The local system time at which the capture was completed.

parameter.name: Count
parameter.description: The number of packets recorded to the file target.
